docs.snippet: Some of the domestic refineries of Russia's largest oil producer Rosneft have been hit hard by tax reforms and weaker oil prices, putting a strain on profits, sources and analysts told Reuters on Friday....

docs.snippet: Four people died and more than 100 were injured after a powerful earthquake struck the island of Mindanao in the southern Philippines late Friday, damaging some structures and cutting power in many areas, local officials said....

headline.main: Earthquake in Southern Philippines Kills Four, Damages Infrastructure

docs.snippet: Congressional Democrats on Friday called for an investigation into whether White House National Security Adviser Michael Flynn discussed U.S. sanctions in phone calls with Russia's ambassador while President Barack Obama was still in office, conve...
docs.lead_paragraph: Congressional Democrats on Friday called for an investigation into whether White House National Security Adviser Michael Flynn discussed U.S. sanctions in phone calls with Russia's ambassador while President Barack Obama was still in office, conversations that may have broken U.S. law aimed at barring private citizens from conducting diplomacy.

headline.main: Democrats Seek Investigation Into National Security Adviser
headline.print_headline: Democrats Seek Investigation Into National Security Adviser

docs.snippet: It took a single image for both David Oyelowo and Amma Asante to fall for the true story of Seretse Khama and Ruth Williams. The cover of Susan Williams' book "Colour Bar: The Triumph of Seretse Khama and His Nation" shows a dapper looking couple ...
docs.lead_paragraph: It took a single image for both David Oyelowo and Amma Asante to fall for the true story of Seretse Khama and Ruth Williams. The cover of Susan Williams' book "Colour Bar: The Triumph of Seretse Khama and His Nation" shows a dapper looking couple in the late 1940s walking hand in hand. Ruth is white. Seretse is black. And the mere fact of their decision to marry would rock the social fabric of their respective worlds and result eventually in Seretse's exile from his country.

headline.main: 'A United Kingdom' Reclaims the History of the Colonized
headline.print_headline: 'A United Kingdom' Reclaims the History of the Colonized

docs.snippet: A Philippines court granted protection on Friday to families of five people killed or wounded by police and the right to access police case reports, in the first successful legal challenge to President Rodrigo Duterte's deadly crackdown on drugs....

headline.main: Families of Victims of Philippines Drug Crackdown Win Legal Challenge
